content: aaaauuuuttttuuuummmmnnnn ppppuuuummmmppppkkkkiiiinnnnssss designed by jan lewis i wasn t happy with the pumpkin patterns that i found so i created one of my own this is an intermediate pattern which includes working in the round increases and decreases provisional co and i-cord i prefer the two circular method of knitting in the round but you may use dpns or magic loop if you prefer materials and info yarn - the pumpkins pictured used plymouth encore worsted any worsted weight yarn will work though needles - size us 6 circular needles and size us 5 dpns for i-cord or a size that creates a fairly tight fabric so stuffing doesn t show through gauge - not important size - smallish but i will add instructions for larger ones when time permits *techniques - i used a crochet provisional cast on but if you prefer you can cast on normally and then pick up stitches around the bottom after stuffing krl increase - backward loop increase directions can be found a http //www knittinghelp com body 1 using waste yarn cast on 30 stitches using provisional cast on of your choice 2 leaving a 10 inch tail and main color orange join and k2 p1 around 30 sts 3 k1 increase 1 k1 p1 around 40 sts 4 k1 increase 1 k2 p1 around 50 sts 5 knit 4 p1 for appx 4 inches 6 k1 k2tog k1 p1 around 40 sts 7 k2tog k1 p1 around 30 sts cut yarn leaving a tail to weave in 8 knit two row with stem color brown and cut leaving 10 in tail 9 put brown tail on a yarn needle and slip through stitches on needles and pull tight closing hole slip through stitches again to help secure it and remove needle weave in end 10 stuff pumpkin firmly but not packed too tight 11 pick up stitches from provisional cast on and remove waste yarn if you chose a normal cast on pick up 30 stitches along edge fairly evenly 12 thread orange tail on yarn needle and work through stitches and then start cinching it up if you need a little more stuffing now is the time to do it you don t want it too firm for this next step though thread through stitches again to tighten it up and close hole with a few stitches if necessary 13 after you ve cinched up the bottom squeeze pumpkin at top and bottom making sure needle is in center of bottom push needle through top and pull through squeeze pumpkin again and push needle back to bottom center creating a squatty little pumpkin careful not to lose your needle in the pumpkin you can vary this part as you like for different effects secure end weave it in i- cord stem -
